chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant David Demetrius Trotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unauthorized Use Of Entity's Identifying Information Or Documents, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 2 years.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  Fine in the amount of $1000.00.  Restitution in the amount of $4683.03 payable to Auto Zone. All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Unauthorized Use Of Entity's Identifying Information Or Documents

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Demetrius Trotter

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant David Demetrius Trotter in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for David Demetrius Trotter.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 2 YEARS.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $1000.00; 
Restitution in the amount of $4638.03 payable to Autozone.
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant David Demetrius Trotter in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and in negotiation status.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  NK

Defendant David Demetrius Trotter in court with Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Meinecke. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608CH.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
appointment letter from SPD that defendant is eligible for representation and one has not been appointed at time of filing, received and filed
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Oral No Contact Order with Auto Zone at 10202 W. Silver Spring Dr. Milwaukee, WI.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant David Demetrius Trotter in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant David Demetrius Trotter in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Demetrius Trotter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant David Demetrius Trotter not in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/14/2022 @ 2:30p
